content.description: This route heads up the blue streak about 15 feet left of Black Parade.  Crimpy moves, with yet another high crux.
content.location: East side of The Foyer, about halfway down.

content.description:
A nice flowing power endurance route that ascends the large overhanging prow facing the iconic waterfall. Technical and powerful climbing through multiple cruxes all the way to the chains. Stick clip the first bolt as there is a boulder problem entry fee.

N

ote: When the water flows over the very top of the falls in late spring and early summer the top of the route can be wet due to spray.
content.protection: 9 bolts to chain anchor with fixed carabiners.
content.location: Walk out of The Foyer and down the hill passing Adventure Time on the left. The large prow facing the falls.

content.description: At the far end of the Foyer across from Chocolate Muffin Warmup. A commiting reach right off the ground with the first bolt high encourages stickclippery for safety. Once ou have made it past the first reach the rest of the climb zigzags up the arete above to ring anchors at the top of the wall.
content.protection: Stickclip recomended, bolts to ring Anchor
content.location: Far left end of Foyer across from Chocolate Muffin Warmup, the climb faces the falls.

content.description: The first route you come to as you drop into the Foyer. Start on the built up platform and climb easy moves following cracks and good holds to the top of the wall.
content.location: Start off the built up platform.

content.description: A series of pinches leads to a high crux before the chains.
content.location: About 10 feet to the right of Black Parade, on the east side of The Foyer.

content.description: Pocketed face climb under large chockstone.  Good warm-up climb for the rest of the area.
content.location: On the west side, right of Chocolate Muffin Warm Up.  Starts under the large chockstone

content.description: A delicate move off the ground leads to easier climbing through the choss band surmounting a small roof and finishing just below the top of the wall. This route is easily identifyable as the one with the longest set of chains for anchors.
content.location: Just left of the trail down to the rest of the canyon with painted hangers.

content.description: This left-leaning flake makes for a great jughaul.  The holds are all there, and you really get your pump going.
content.location: On the east side of The Foyer, this climb is 5-10 feet left of Death from Above.  Look for the obvious flake.

content.description: Easy pulls to the roof. Step up clip (a little spooky) then thin pulls to some aggressive block climbing. Finish up on mellow arete climbing.
content.location: Climbs the left side arete as leaving the Foyer.

content.description: Moderate climbing on crimps leads to a boulder problem surrmounting the small roof at 2/3rds height. Cliping the bolt above the roof provides the crux for most. More moderate climbing leads to the anchors just left of the chockstone.
content.location: Directly below the chockstone on the overhanging side of the foyer.

content.description: Another delicate start through the choss band leads to easy low angle climbing to a ledge with the chains.
content.location: 2nd route left of the trail down to the rest of the canyon

content.description: At the far end of the foyer where you can look down at the falls is a short route up a slightly vegitated slab. This route is the easiest in the area and bolted well for a first time leader. Climb up large ledges past 3 bolts to chain anchors. don't let the vegitation fool you this is a very fun very easy outing for those who are interested.
content.location: Most south west route in the Foyer or the closest route to the falls inside of the Foyer.

content.description: One of the best 5.11s in the canyon. An unfortunate start on top of the choss band leads past several hard to find holds to good rest ledges and then a final boulder problem to the jug horizontals and the anchors. The crux of the route revolves around probably the most perfect limestone sloper ever. High praise, go climb it and decide for yourself.
content.location: Just below and oposite of Taste of Grit. This is the first route on the left side of the Foyer as you enter it.

content.description:
After a bouldery start, this climb pulls onto the face with a great jug, and is pretty straightforward from there.

Watch out for the possibility of bird nests...there was one in a bigger hold on this route when I climbed it a few years ago.  It was an old nest, with no chicks or eggs, but just keep your eyes out our avian friends.
content.location: On the west side, third boltline from the left, or second from the right.

content.description: Fun slab climbing leads to a no hands at the break. Traverse slightly left on incut edges, clip the first bolt on the headwall, and work up through multiple cruxes with lots of cool holds and a pumpy finish. Catches lots of sun.
content.location: Walk down from the Foyer and scoot left around to the other side of the wall that faces the waterfall. Two routes climbers' right of Whitewater.

content.description:
This route is a true gem. It is easily one of the best 5.11+ routes in SW Montana, and is an excellent project for anyone climbing at that level. It also functions as a great warmup for projecting Whitewater around the corner, or routes on the shipwreck wall next door.

If it feels too hard, you missed a pocket. It is recommended to stick clip the second bolt.
content.location: Heading downhill from the Foyer, it's on the left.
